column1: Schenker MT and Ince S and Ney LJ and Hsu CK and Zuj DV and Jordan AS and Nicholas CL and Felmingham KL
column4: Sex differences in the effect of subjective sleep on fear conditioning, extinction learning, and extinction recall in individuals with a range of PTSD symptom severity.
column7: Female;Humans;Male;Sex Characteristics;Extinction, Psychological;Fear;Stress Disorders, Post-Traumatic;Mental Recall;Sleep;*Stress Disorders, Post-Traumatic/complications
column44: not explicitly reported, but apparently sqrt-transformation was conducted on trial level
column46: Raw SCR data were skewed, thus square-root data transformation using absolute values (Lonsdorf et al., 2017, 2022) were compared to the raw data to test whether model assumptions improved. Overall, the distribution of the residuals versus fitted values was similar and the models using raw and transformed data yielded similar effects (see Tables A.2-A.27 in the appendix). Therefore untransformed values were used for the present analyses to facilitate interpretation (Gelman & Hill, 2006; Tabachnick & Fidell, 2007).
column53: Authors superficially reported, that model assumptions for linear mixed models have been checked (which should include normality, linearity etc.), but do not go into detail. Formula for mixed model: Response - Stimulus x Trial x PTSD-Score + (1|id)

column44: Note: For eye tracking fixation times, trial-based dwell-times were divided by the total sum of fixations to derive proportion values. I assume on trial-level, but it's not explicitly stated in the text.
